TwoFactorInfo.name: TwoFactorInfo
TwoFactorInfo.description: Stores a user’s secret for multi-factor operations. Use this object when customizing multi-factor authentication in your organization. (Note that multi-factor authentication was formerly called two-factor authentication.)

SharedKey.description: This field is never read-enabled, though it is write-enabled. A request for this value always returns null. The value must be a base32-encoded string of a 20-byte secret. You can use the Apex method Auth.SessionManagement.getQrCode() to get a value to write to this field. Note If you write a secret to this field, in API version 37.0 and later the user gets an email notification that a new identity verification method was added to the user’s account.

Type.description: The multi-factor method. TOTP—The time-based one-time password.

UserId.description: The ID for the user who’s associated with the authentication secret.
